item.title: What Anthropic's Constitution Reveals About Enterprise AI Governance
item.description:
Anthropic published Claude’s complete constitution in January 2026 â€” 23,000 words defining who their AI is, how it reasons through conflicts, and what it will and won’t do regardless of who asks. This wasn’t a safety white paper. It’s a governance specification that establishes authority over AI behavior, determines what can be modified and by whom, and prescribes how conflicts get resolved.

The overarching question is stark: do you own your AI agent’s behavior, or do you rent it from the foundation provider?
